data.title: Serena Williams' legendary tennis career likely over after third-round singles' play loss at US Open
data.description: Serena Williams' legendary tennis career has likely come to an end after she fell to Australia's Ajla Tomljanović in the third round of the US Open at Arthur Ashe Stadium in Flushing, New York. The 23-time grand slam singles champion leaves an indelible mark, not only on tennis, but all of sport.

data.title: Roger Federer denied entry to Wimbledon grounds by overly eager security guard
data.description: Diehard Wimbledon fans know how hard it can be to get into the grounds of the famed tennis tournament, with spectators often camping overnight to get in a pole position to join a seemingly endless queue just for a chance to watch the championships.

data.title: Simona Halep provisionally suspended after testing positive for banned substance
data.description: Former world No. 1 Simona Halep has been provisionally suspended from tennis after testing positive for a prohibited substance at this year's US Open.

data.title: Carlos Alcaraz defeats Frances Tiafoe at the US Open semifinals in a battle of tennis' rising stars
data.description: Frances Tiafoe's run at the US Open ended Friday with a loss to No. 3 seed Carlos Alcaraz in the semifinals.

data.title: For Messi and Ronaldo, a final shot at World Cup glory
data.description: For Messi and Ronaldo, a final shot at World Cup glory

data.title: Ukraine's Marta Kostyuk chooses not to shake hands with Belarusian opponent Victoria Azarenka at US Open
data.description: Ukrainian tennis player Marta Kostyuk refused to shake hands with Belarusian opponent Victoria Azarenka after their US Open match on Thursday.

data.title: Rafael Nadal says he and his family are 'very well' after birth of first child
data.description: Rafael Nadal says he's thankful for all the messages of support and well-wishes he has received since the birth of his son.

data.title: World of sport reacts to Roger Federer's retirement
data.description: The outpouring of praise and admiration in the wake of Roger Federer's retirement announcement is a testament to the Swiss tennis star's remarkable impact and legacy in the world of tennis, sport and beyond.

data.title: Roger Federer brings down curtain on his career with a defeat, but still dazzles alongside longtime friend and rival Rafael Nadal
data.description: Swiss tennis great Roger Federer has lost his final professional match, playing doubles alongside contemporary and rival Rafael Nadal of Spain at the Laver Cup.

data.title: Iga Swiatek reaches first US Open final, will face fifth seed Ons Jabeur
data.description: World No. 1 Iga Swiatek will contest her first US Open final on Saturday after coming from behind to defeat Aryna Sabalenka 3-6 6-1 6-4.

data.title: Rafael Nadal overcomes Fabio Fognini in four sets in US Open second round
data.description: Rafael Nadal overcame accidentally hitting himself in the face with his own racket to beat Fabio Fognini in the US Open second round.

data.title: Serena and Venus Williams knocked out of doubles' play by Czech duo at US Open
data.description: Serena Williams' illustrious doubles career has likely come to an end after she and her sister Venus fell in straight sets to the Czech duo of Linda Nosková and Lucie Hradecká in the first round of the US Open at Arthur Ashe Stadium in New York.

data.title: Wimbledon relaxes all-white clothing rules for women players
data.description: Wimbledon will relax its white clothing rule to allow women players to wear dark-colored undershorts if they want to, organizers announced Thurday.

data.title: Serena Williams 'paved the way' for mothers to keep playing tennis, says Martina Navratilova
data.description: Tennis great Martina Navratilova thinks more women will continue to play professional tennis after having children -- thanks largely to Serena Williams.

data.title: Djokovic leaves no stone unturned in pursuit of perfection, but secrecy with drink mixture draws scrutiny
data.description: In his pursuit of greatness, it has been well documented that Novak Djokovic has left no stone unturned.

data.title: Serena Williams hails Tiger Woods' influence as she continues her US Open run
data.description: It was a performance that had Tiger Woods on his feet and pumping his fist -- a sight usually witnessed on the 18th hole of a golf course, rather than the stands of Arthur Ashe Stadium.

data.title: Emma Raducanu's former coach Dmitry Tursunov says he left because of 'red flags'
data.description: Dmitry Tursunov says he decided to stop coaching Emma Raducanu at the end of his trial period with the tennis star because of "red flags" that he could not ignore.

data.title: Roger Federer announces his retirement from the ATP Tour and grand slams
data.description: Roger Federer has announced that he will retire from the ATP Tour and grand slams following the Laver Cup next week in London.

data.title: Rafael Nadal isn't confident about World Tour Finals after suffering Paris Masters defeat
data.description: Rafael Nadal is out of the Paris Masters after being defeated by Tommy Paul -- and the Spaniard isn't betting on winning the ATP Tour Finals, either.

data.title: Wu Yibing becomes first Chinese man to reach the US Open third round since 1881
data.description: At every stage of this year's US Open, Wu Yibing has made history.

data.title: Nick Kyrgios complains of marijuana smell during US Open second round win
data.description: Nick Kyrgios was left frustrated by the smell of marijuana coming from the stands in his second round win at the US Open on Wednesday.

data.title: Behind the 'raw' photo of Roger Federer and Rafael Nadal that captures their enduring friendship
data.description: Photographer Ella Ling expected Roger Federer's farewell from tennis to be charged with emotion -- though when the moment arrived, the outpouring of tears and adulation caught her by surprise.

data.title: Carlos Alcaraz reaches first grand slam semifinal after marathon, late-night finish against Jannik Sinner
data.description: At 2:50 a.m. local time in New York, Carlos Alcaraz triumphed in a captivating, five-set encounter against Jannik Sinner at the US Open to reach his first grand slam semifinal.

data.title: Naomi Osaka pulls out of Pan Pacific Open in Tokyo due to illness on Thursday
data.description: Four-time grand slam champion Naomi Osaka withdrew from her second-round match against Beatriz Haddad Maia at the Pan Pacific Open on Thursday due to illness, ending her title defense at the tournament.

data.title: 20 moments that defined Messi's career
data.description: 20 moments that defined Messi's career

data.title: Serena Williams teases return to competitive tennis, says Tom Brady 'started a really cool trend'
data.description: Little more than two weeks after she was knocked out of the US Open -- a moment many thought would be the last act of her tennis career -- Serena Williams has teased her potential return to the sport.

data.title: Donna Vekic suffers mid-air fright ahead of Guadalajara victory
data.description: Croatian Donna Vekic said she was 'freaking out' after the door of the helicopter she was traveling in to the Guadalajara Open in Mexico opened mid-flight.

data.title: Carlos Alcaraz becomes youngest year-end No. 1 in men's tennis as Rafael Nadal's slump continues at ATP Finals
data.description: Carlos Alcaraz is set to become the youngest year-end No. 1 in the history of men's tennis after Rafael Nadal was knocked out of the ATP Finals.

data.title: 'Just Serena': Williams' upset win at US Open keeps the legend advancing in final days of her storied career
data.description: Serena Williams, playing what could be the last US Open of her career, won Wednesday evening, downing Anett Kontaveit 7-6 (4) 2-6 6-2 in New York.

data.title: WTA Tour set to return to China in 2023 following suspension over Peng Shuai situation
data.description: The Women's Tennis Association (WTA) announced Tuesday that it will return to hosting tournaments in China in 2023 after previously suspending all events in the country, including Hong Kong, last November due to the uncertainty over tennis player Peng Shuai's safety.

data.title: Novak Djokovic is welcome at Australian Open, says tournament director; Russian and Belarusian players can compete
data.description: Novak Djokovic would be welcomed to play at the Australian Open if he can obtain a visa, according to tournament director Craig Tiley.

data.title: Roger Federer set to play 'special' final match of career on Friday with Rafael Nadal
data.description: After numerous close battles against each other over the years, Roger Federer will get to enjoy what he called a "special moment" in partnering with Rafael Nadal for the final match of his career.

data.title: Meet Gonçalo Ramos, the striker who replaced Cristiano Ronaldo and made World Cup history at Qatar 2022
data.description: Talk about performing under pressure and making an impression at Qatar 2022, Gonçalo Ramos certainly rose to the occasion for Portugal.

data.title: Nick Kyrgios 'devastated' after quarterfinal defeat to Karen Khachanov as he destroys two rackets on court
data.description: This US Open seemed like a golden opportunity for Nick Kyrgios to win his first-ever grand slam.

data.title: How Frances Tiafoe went from sleeping at a tennis center to the US Open semifinals
data.description: Expectations of US tennis player Frances Tiafoe have been high for a long time and the world No. 26 is now looking more than comfortable on the sport's biggest stage.

data.title: Rafael Nadal drops first set but rallies to defeat Rinky Hijikata at US Open
data.description: Rafael Nadal dropped his opening set at the US Open but recovered to defeat Australian wildcard Rinky Hijikata 4-6 6-2 6-3 6-3.

data.title: US tennis star feels some people don't want Black players to succeed
data.description: He's one of his country's brightest prospects on the tennis tour, but US star Frances Tiafoe says a lack of diversity in the sport makes him feels like an "outsider."

data.title: World No. 1 Iga Swiatek comes from behind to defeat Jule Niemeier, advancing to US Open quarterfinals
data.description: Two-time grand slam champion Iga Swiatek has reached her first US Open quarterfinal in New York after escaping an upset by unseeded Jule Niemeier.

data.title: Caroline Garcia wins biggest title of her career at WTA Finals
data.description: Caroline Garcia capped off a remarkable six-month period in her tennis career as she won the WTA Finals with a 7-6 6-4 victory against Aryna Sabalenka in Fort Worth, Texas.

data.title: Serena Williams teases tennis fans as she says 'I'm not retired'
data.description: Serena Williams continues to tease tennis fans about whether they will see her back on court, this time saying she is "not retired" from the sport.

data.title: Carlos Alcaraz reaches US Open quarterfinal with late-night win against Marin Cilic
data.description: The US Open men's draw is guaranteed to have a first-time grand slam champion after Marin Cilic, the 2014 champion in New York, was beaten in five sets by Carlos Alcaraz.

data.title: Australia to overturn Djokovic visa ban, paving way for Australian Open return
data.description: Australia will overturn a three-year ban on champion tennis player Novak Djokovic entering the country, paving the way for the former world No. 1 to contest the 2023 Australian Open.

data.title: American Frances Tiafoe upsets Rafael Nadal in 4th round of US Open
data.description: Twenty-two-time grand slam champion Rafael Nadal was upset in the fourth round of the US Open on Monday by American Frances Tiafoe at Arthur Ashe Stadium in Flushing, New York.

data.title: Nick Bollettieri, famed tennis coach, dies aged 91
data.description: Nick Bollettieri, the famed tennis coach who taught the likes of the Williams sisters, Andre Agassi and Maria Sharapova, has died aged 91.

data.title: Billie Jean King's 'pet peeve' is Wimbledon's 'horrible' all white uniform policy
data.description: Clothes aren't just items to keep you warm or cool -- they also indicate status, showcase defiance, and even alleviate anxieties.

data.title: 'More grand slams': Carlos Alcaraz already has sights set on 2023 glory after US Open triumph
data.description: To many on the outside, Carlos Alcaraz lifting the US Open trophy looked like the culmination of years of hard work, dedication and sacrifice. To Alcaraz himself, however, his first grand slam triumph is only the beginning.

data.title: Simona Halep's former coach says 'no chance' the two-time grand slam champion knowingly took banned substance
data.description: Simona Halep's former coach has jumped to her defense after the former world No. 1 tested positive for a banned substance at the US Open earlier this year.

data.title: Novak Djokovic defeats Stefanos Tsitsipas in Astana Open final to win his 90th career ATP title
data.description: Novak Djokovic claimed his 90th career ATP Tour title by cruising past Stefanos Tsitsipas in the final of the Astana Open in Kazakhstan.

data.title: Top seed Daniil Medvedev beaten by Nick Kyrgios at US Open
data.description: Defending champion Daniil Medvedev was knocked out of the US Open after losing 6-7 6-3 3-6 2-6 against Nick Kyrgios in the fourth round.

data.title: Danish teenager defeats Novak Djokovic to announce himself on the world stage
data.description: Teenager Holger Rune stunned Novak Djokovic in the final of the Paris Masters on Sunday, winning 3-6 6-3 7-5 against the 21-time grand slam champion.

data.title: Carlos Alcaraz defeats Casper Ruud to win the US Open final
data.description: Carlos Alcaraz is now the youngest world No. 1 in the history of the ATP rankings after defeating Casper Ruud in the US Open Final on Sunday.

data.title: Rafael Nadal withdraws from Laver Cup due to 'personal reasons'
data.description: Rafael Nadal has withdrawn from the remainder of the Laver Cup due to personal reasons, after partnering with his longtime rival and friend Roger Federer in doubles to mark the end of Federer's career.

data.title: Rafael Nadal says 'a part of his life left' when Roger Federer retired
data.description: Rafael Nadal admitted that "a part of his life left" with Roger Federer when his great rival retired from tennis -- with both players left an emotional wreck on court after the Swiss played his last ever competitive match in September at the Laver Cup.

data.title: World No. 1 Iga Swiatek wins her third major title at the US Open
data.description: Polish tennis star Iga Swiatek defeated Tunisia's Ons Jabeur in straight sets in the US Open women's singles final at Arthur Ashe Stadium in Flushing, New York.

data.title: How Serena Williams rewrote the playbook for female athletes juggling motherhood and sport
data.description: When Serena Williams announced that she would "evolve away from tennis," she was pictured with her five-year-old daughter, Alexis Olympia Ohanian Jr.

data.title: Nick Kyrgios settles legal case with Wimbledon fan he accused of being 'drunk out of her mind,' her lawyers say
data.description: The lawyers for a Wimbledon spectator accused by Nick Kyrgios of being 'drunk out of her mind,' have released an apology from the tennis star and say their client's claim has been resolved.

data.title: Roger Federer, a genius who made tennis look effortless
data.description: We are living through a period where the expected has surprised. In life, there is always an ending. Always. We know this. We anticipate this. We try to prepare for this. But when the passing of time forces a chapter to inevitably close, the reality of it all still stuns like a thunderbolt.

data.title: Serena Williams has done it all in tennis, but there's so much more to come
data.description: Twenty-seven years on the professional tour, 23 grand slam singles titles and a plethora of records; Serena Williams is leaving tennis as one of the greatest players to ever grace the court.

data.title: Football world wishes Pelé well as the Brazilian star remains in hospital
data.description: Past and present football stars have been wishing Pelé well on social media after local media reports in Brazil that his health had worsened.

data.title: Russian teenager banned from tennis for nine months following anti-doping breach
data.description: A 14-year-old Russian tennis player has been banned from the sport for nine months following an anti-doping breach, the International Tennis Integrity Agency (ITIA) has said in a statement on Friday.

data.title: Serbian scientists name new species of beetle after Novak Djokovic
data.description: Serbian scientists have named a new species of beetle after tennis great Novak Djokovic due to its speed, strength, flexibility, durability and ability to survive in a difficult environment, Serbian media reported on Friday.

data.title: 'An important part of my life is leaving too,' says emotional Rafael Nadal
data.description: When the end came neither Roger Federer or Rafael Nadal could hold back the tears.

data.title: Christian Pulisic on track to play for USMNT on Saturday
data.description: US Men's National Team head coach Gregg Berhalter had good news for fans on Friday, saying that star player Christian Pulisic is looking likely to play in the team's round of 16 World Cup clash against the Netherlands on Saturday.
